titleInfo.title: Glassco v. Houston
titleInfo.subTitle: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER granting 2 Motion for Leave to Proceed in forma pauperis. After considering Petitioner's financial status as shown in the records of this court, provisional leave to proceed in forma pauperis will be granted and Petitioner is relieved from paying the fee at this time. Ordered by Senior Judge Richard G. Kopf. (Copy mailed/e-mailed to pro se party)(JAB)

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER granting 2 Motion for Leave to Proceed in forma pauperis. After considering Petitioner's financial status as shown in the records of this court, provisional leave to proceed in forma pauperis will be granted and Petitioner is relieved from paying the fee at this time. Ordered by Senior Judge Richard G. Kopf. (Copy mailed/e-mailed to pro se party)(JAB)

titleInfo.title: Glassco v. Houston
titleInfo.subTitle: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER - Upon initial review of the Petition (filing no. 1), the court preliminarily determines that Claims One, Two, Three, Four, Five, Eight, and Nine, as set forth in this Memorandum and Order, are potentially cognizable in federal court. The court determines that Claims Six and Seven are not cognizable in a federal court habeas action and are therefore dismissed. By March 16, 2012, Respondent shall file a motion for summary judgment or state court records in support of an answer. No discovery shall be undertaken without leave of the court. Petitioner's Motion for Leave to Supplement (filing no. 6) is granted. (Pro Se Case Management Deadline set for 3/16/2012: deadline for Respondent to file state court records in support of answer or motion for summary judgment) Ordered by Senior Judge Richard G. Kopf. (Copy mailed to pro se party) (Copies mailed as directed to Respondents and Nebraska Attorney General) (TEL)

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER - Upon initial review of the Petition (filing no. 1), the court preliminarily determines that Claims One, Two, Three, Four, Five, Eight, and Nine, as set forth in this Memorandum and Order, are potentially cognizable in federal court. The court determines that Claims Six and Seven are not cognizable in a federal court habeas action and are therefore dismissed. By March 16, 2012, Respondent shall file a motion for summary judgment or state court records in support of an answer. No discovery shall be undertaken without leave of the court. Petitioner's Motion for Leave to Supplement (filing no. 6) is granted. (Pro Se Case Management Deadline set for 3/16/2012: deadline for Respondent to file state court records in support of answer or motion for summary judgment) Ordered by Senior Judge Richard G. Kopf. (Copy mailed to pro se party) (Copies mailed as directed to Respondents and Nebraska Attorney General) (TEL)

titleInfo.title: Glassco v. Houston
titleInfo.subTitle: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER regarding Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus1.1. Glassco's Petition (Filing No. 1) is dismissed with prejudice. 2. A separate judgment will be entered in accordance with this Memorandum and Order. 3. All pending motions are denied as moot. Ordered by Senior Judge Richard G. Kopf. (Copy mailed to pro se party)(JAB)

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska

titleInfo.title: Glassco v. Houston
titleInfo.subTitle: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER - IT IS THEREFORE ORDERED that: Petitioner's Motion for Leave to Proceed IFP on Appeal is granted. (Filing No. 28.) Petitioner's Motion for Certificate of Appealability (Filing No. 29) is denied without prejudice to reassertion before the Eighth Circuit. The Clerk of the court shall provide the Court of Appeals a copy of this Memorandum and Order. Ordered by Senior Judge Richard G. Kopf. (Copy mailed to pro se party and as directed)(TCL )

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
